intro: Psychotria bertiera, commonly known as the "soul of the forest," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white or greenish flowers. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria bertiera is also notable for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in various herbal remedies.
